meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be counted or listed.
meanings.sent1: The teacher praised the students for their excellent enumerabilities in the math quiz.
meanings.sent2: The enumerabilities of the items in the inventory made it easy to keep track of everything.
meanings.sent3: The party planner's meticulous enumerabilities of the guest list ensured no one was left out.
meanings.sent4: Her enumerabilities in organizing her thoughts were like a well-arranged bouquet of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen enumerabilities helped him solve the case quickly.

meanings.definition: The ability to be enumerated or listed.
meanings.sent1: The enumerabilities of the different species of birds fascinated the young biologist.
meanings.sent2: The software's enumerabilities allowed users to customize their preferences easily.
meanings.sent3: The magician's enumerabilities of tricks seemed endless to the amazed audience.
meanings.sent4: His enumerabilities in memorizing facts were like a superpower in trivia games.
meanings.sent5: The artist's enumerabilities in creating unique designs set her apart from the rest.
